positions.title: Financial Analyst
positions.description:
Financial Analyst - ChefHero

Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada

Duration: 3 months (extension likely)

Hours: 40 hours/week


DESCRIPTION

Do you spend your spare time exploring the city’s hot new restaurants? Get excited by new emerging technology? ChefHero is currently on the hunt for a savvy Financial Analyst to join our team to help grow our product.

The Financial Analyst role is responsible for the analysis, reporting and execution of the pricing strategy for various vendors and products. In this role you will review all internally developed pricing proposals, outline alternatives, identify trends, prepare analyses, support, utilize pricing applications and ensure payments made to vendors are reconciled and accurate. The position is responsible for supporting pricing integrity (price accuracy) and implementation of agreed-upon pricing strategies. This role requires strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with Sales, Account Management, Client Services, Finance, and other operations departments.

We’re a fun, hardworking bunch that is revolutionizing the restaurant and foodservice industry. If this seems like a recipe for success, we’d love to meet you.

About the job:

The Financial Analyst is responsible for tracking, analyzing and reconciling all vendor invoices via our 2-way price match system to accurately pay suppliers and clients ensuring the company’s capital integrity. This critical role will entail keeping a sharp eye on expenditures, analyzing trends, highlighting deviations from budgets, and working closely with key stakeholders within the business.

Responsibilities:

  • Developing, evaluating and implementing pricing strategies and models based upon current business and competitive market dynamics
  • Continuously monitoring, auditing and analyzing price quote activity to assure systematic risks are identified and corrected, and pricing formulas and tables are properly maintained for approved pricing changes
  • Designing pricing activity reports and perform routine maintenance of pricing activity reports to assure management visibility of pricing activities and the ability to evaluate integrity of the pricing and discounting processes
  • Conducting research and performing competitive pricing analysis
  • Monitoring ongoing competitive environment to ensure practices do not adversely impact company reputation or customer satisfaction
  • Partnering with Sales/Marketing, Business Development and Finance to correctly advise on pricing policies
  • Updating/Creating pricing databases and coordinate implementation of pricing proposals across multiple verticals/categories
  • Assisting and advising on projects that impact price changes, individual promotions and rebate programs
  • Effectively coordinating pricing exception requests for reasonability and maintenance
  • Developing and maintaining dashboards for all levels of stakeholders
  • Owning and dealing with ad-hoc accounting issues
  • Compiling monthly, quarterly and yearly financials for external and internal users
  • Responsible for completing and coordinating financial audits with external auditors
  • Interfacing with various stakeholders at the company to resolves issues regarding pricing and to ensure the ongoing effective communication remains a top priority
  • A/R and A/P support, as required
  • All other duties as assigned within the scope and spirit of the position.

Requirements:

  • Advanced MS Excel
  • Bachelors Degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Finance, Business or related field of study
  • Minimum 2 years’ experience in data analysis, analytics or finance
  • Must be able to effectively manage competing priorities and deadlines, and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • High comfort level working with large amounts of data
  • Must be a team player, proactive, and possess excellent problem solving and organizational skills
  • Have the flexibility and willingness to meet varied hours
  • Comfortable working within a fast-paced, ever-changing environment
  • Previous experience working at a tech startup is a plus.

About ChefHero:

ChefHero is a wholesale food marketplace that connects restaurants to their suppliers. Our free mobile and web application allows any restaurant to order all their supplies in one easy place. By conveniently allowing customers to collaborate on orders with their sous chef, view prices and products that are updated daily, customize their order sheets and order local or organic food, we reduce human error and allow our customers to easily track their invoices.

At ChefHero we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require any accommodation during the application or interview process, we will work with you to meet your needs.

positions.title: Product Designer (UI/UX)
positions.description:
Product Designer (UI/UX) - ChefHero

Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada

Duration: 3 months (extension possible)

Hours: 3 hours/day on average


ChefHero is a marketplace that connects local food wholesalers and suppliers to local restaurants. Our online platform makes it easy for chefs, restaurateurs, and other buyers to purchase items.


About the Role:

At ChefHero we are building a world-class foodservice product and we need a forward-thinking Product Designer to join our team in Toronto. You have a passion for playing around with a variety of design concepts to improve and expand on user experience based on customer research. You live for excellent design and innovation, and you obsess over the slightest details in order to deliver the highest quality of work. Just like everyone else at ChefHero, you’ll get hands-on experience with the product you’re building, surrounded by a world-class team of entrepreneurs, engineers, and food-obsessed individuals.


Responsibilities:

  • Leverage market research, user testing, and UX best practices to create user-centered solutions
  • Collaborate with our Product Managers to define high-level requirements for product development
  • Work closely with our engineering team to execute on design goals and iterate on feedback from our users
  • Conduct research and brainstorming sessions to develop user flows and compelling user experiences
  • Propose new features and improvement opportunities, and prioritize on effective and actionable designs
  • Validate designs through usability testing
  • Keep up-to-date with UX best practices, trends, and developments
  • Advocate for great user experience throughout the whole company
  • All other duties as assigned within the scope and spirit of the position

Requirements:

  • 2+ years working experience as a Product or UX Designer
  • A solid portfolio of work demonstrating UX and visual design skills
  • High attention to detail
  • Experience working with lean and agile design processes, rapid prototyping, and the ability to jump into any tool of the trade (Sketch, Figma, Zeplin, Invision, Principle, etc.)
  • Experience designing across multiple platforms and understanding modern design patterns for Web, iOS, and Android
  • The ability to design interactions, flows, and experiences that are simple
  • Experience designing/using a design system is considered an asset

We're also looking for people who...

  • Can work in a fast paced startup environment, and are able to stick to and meet deadlines
  • Have been a part of a team that has successfully shipped a digital product
  • Can easily tell the difference between a ‘good’ experience from ‘great’
  • Focus on defining the problem first, to ensure the solution is right for users

At ChefHero we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require any accommodation during the application or interview process, we will work with you to meet your needs. Please contact us at (647)-930-0210.
